238.AgentMessage1: ChurchSource: I'm sorry to hear that! Just to be sure, are you referring to Order #780831? If so, can you please provide the email address associated with the order so I can check on this with the team? In the meantime, for help tracking your order, please make sure you sign in to your account. Register or sign in here: https://churchsource.attn.tv/aBPTCSm5IxGW You will be able to access order tracking from your profile page!
238.customerMessage4: Today is my granddaughter 16th birthday and I don't have her Bible
238.AgentMessage2: ChurchSource: I completely understand your concern and how disappointed you must be right now. Let me check with the team and I'll be back with an update soon.
238.customerMessage5: ‚Äãüëç‚Äã to ‚Äú‚ÄäI completely understand your concern and how disappointed you must be right now. Let me check with the team and I'll be back with an update soon.‚Ää‚Äù
238.AgentMessage3:
ChurchSource: Thanks for your patience! I just heard from the team, and we understand how important this is. Order CS780831 is an ebook order. You can read your ebook purchase in the free Glose app by downloading it to any compatible Apple* or Android** device from your Apple app or Google Play Store, or by going to glose.com
 
 1. Launch the app or visit glose.com, and from the menu select Log In
 2. Select Other Sign In Options
 3. Select HarperCollins
 4. Enter the email address and Password you used to purchase your eBook.
 5. Select the book you would like to read and chose Read or Resume
 
Here is a video example: https://churchsource.attn.tv/ah_LDOyW_Vwa
 
Unfortunately, since eBooks are unable to be returned, we are not able to offer any refunds on these orders. The exception to this rule is if you were to place a replacement order for the physical edition of the book and provide the new order number as proof of purchase. At that point we would be able to issue a credit for the eBook.

If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to contact me. We're here to help!
238.customerMessage6: No it was not an ebook. It was two Bibles
238.customerMessage7: I have never bought ebooks. I have no way to read them.
238.AgentMessage4: ChurchSource: I understand. Please note that these Bibles are in an ebook version. You can follow the instructions I have provided on how to use your purchased ebook. Hope this clears things up.

240.customerMessage1: Do human beings check your text messages? I'm having trouble with your website.
240.AgentMessage1: Stonewall Kitchen: I'm sorry to hear that. Yes, we monitor texts here, and I'm a real person. What specific issues are you experiencing? What's the error message? First, I might suggest trying to open the site in an incognito or private window to rule out any browser cache or extension issues.
240.customerMessage2: Oh wonderful thank you! The problem I'm having is built into your website. I've been trying to get an order in since the day after Christmas if you can believe it. One thing or another always comes up. The latest is I get a message that says "one or more items in your cart is out of stock and we cannot fill your order. Please go back in and check availability". Well, that's a real pain in the patootie because I have about nine things in my cart. You're going to get a lot of cart abandonment this way.
240.customerMessage3: It should tell me exactly what is out of stock.
240.customerMessage4: 9 out of 10 customers would abandon the cart at this point. I have an internet business too, kelly green organic.com
240.AgentMessage2:
Stonewall Kitchen: I'm so sorry you've been running into this, especially after trying to place an order for so long. I completely understand how frustrating it is to get that message without knowing which item is causing the issue. It's definitely not the experience we want for our customers.

Could you please send me a screenshot of the items currently in your cart? That way, I can check availability on my end and help you get your order completed. Once I see what's in your cart, I can figure out which items are in stock and help you move forward.
240.customerMessage5: Ok. I'll let you know less to complain and more so that maybe you could work with your website and tweak it so that a customer would get notified exactly what to do and be able to check out easily. Like I said, I have an online business too. So I'll take a screenshot and here we go
240.customerMessage6: Oh it gave you the wrong link earlier that's not my website. KellyGreenOrganic.com

240.SystemMessage16: Template used: "Feedback 1 - All brands"; last updated: 2023-10-10 18:03:27.339
240.AgentMessage3: Stonewall Kitchen: I'm really sorry for the trouble! Customer feedback means a lot to us and helps us keep improving. I truly appreciate you sharing this, and I'll be sure to pass it along to our team for future consideration. I will pass this along to my team and get back to you as soon as possible. Hang tight!
